adjustObjFrame() - Method in class pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser.BXMLLoaderButton
 

B

BlockingDialog - Class in pivot_contrib.guretzki
Can host any Dialog outside of the normal Application HostFrame; this way, awt is used to do the BlockingDialog.open(Display) in a blocking way, i. e. the flow of control doesn't return before the content Dialog is closed.
BlockingDialog() - Constructor for class pivot_contrib.guretzki.BlockingDialog
 
BlockingDialog(Dialog) - Constructor for class pivot_contrib.guretzki.BlockingDialog
 
BlockingDialogTest - Class in pivot_contrib.guretzki.test
Demonstrates the BlockingDialog Class
BlockingDialogTest() - Constructor for class pivot_contrib.guretzki.test.BlockingDialogTest
 
buttonPressed(Button) - Method in class pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser.BXMLBrowser
 
BXMLBrowser - Class in pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser
Frame that allows selecting .bxml files below the current directory and instantiating their contents via a BXMLLoaderButton.
BXMLBrowser() - Constructor for class pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser.BXMLBrowser
 
BXMLBrowserApp - Class in pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser
Pivot Application (including static BXMLBrowserApp.main(String[]) method for direct startup) that uses BXMLBrowser to allow selecting .bxml files below the current directory and instantiating their contents via a BXMLLoaderButton.
BXMLBrowserApp() - Constructor for class pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser.BXMLBrowserApp
 
BXMLLoaderButton - Class in pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser
PushButton that includes the capability to load any .bxml file containing a Component as root element Optionally, this can be done using a temporary ClassLoader, so that changes to the classes during runtime get included.
BXMLLoaderButton() - Constructor for class pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser.BXMLLoaderButton
Constructor initializes the ButtonPressListener, too.

C

close() - Method in class pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser.BXMLLoaderButton
Close the window resulting from the loaded .bxml file The classloader used for loading is (hopefully) discarded, too.

MostlyDelegatingURLClassLoader - Class in pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser
Behaves generally like URLClassLoader, with the addition that any number of class names can be excepted from ClassLoader delegation.

N

NonDelegatingURLClassLoader - Class in pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser
Uses a hierarchy of NonDelegatingURLClassLoaders to find out if any ancestor ClassLoader has already loaded a class that was requested; however, the actual loading of new classes is done by the lowermost NonDelegatingURLClassLoader.
NonDelegatingURLClassLoader(URL[], String...) - Constructor for class pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser.NonDelegatingURLClassLoader
Constructor.
NonDelegatingURLClassLoader(URL[], ClassLoader, String...) - Constructor for class pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser.NonDelegatingURLClassLoader
"Luxury" constructor
NonDelegatingURLClassLoader(ClassLoader, String...) - Constructor for class pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser.NonDelegatingURLClassLoader
Another constructor

O

open(Display) - Method in class pivot_contrib.guretzki.BlockingDialog
Open Dialog and return Content.

P

pivot_contrib.guretzki - package pivot_contrib.guretzki
This package has two functions: It's the root of all source of the guretzki part of the Apache Extras pivot-contrib project and it contains all classes that can sensibly be used from within .bxml files.
pivot_contrib.guretzki.awtlink - package pivot_contrib.guretzki.awtlink
Classes in this package allow using Pivot Components within AWT Dialogs.
pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser - package pivot_contrib.guretzki.bxmlbrowser
Functionality for developers: Two ways of invoking a helper application that allows easy reloading of .bxml files to immeditately preview the effects of changes.
pivot_contrib.guretzki.test - package pivot_contrib.guretzki.test
Hosts test and/ or example classes for the guretzki part of the Apache Extras pivot-contrib project
processWindowEvent(WindowEvent) - Method in class pivot_contrib.guretzki.awtlink.HostDialog
